metadata.title: CVE-2018-6033 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Insufficient data validation in Downloads in Google Chrome prior to64.0.3282.119 allowed a remote attacker to potentially run arbitrary codeoutside sandbox via a crafted Chrome Extension.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-6033` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 64.0.3282.119-0ubuntu1
chromium-browser-l10n - 64.0.3282.119-0ubuntu1
chromium-chromedriver - 64.0.3282.119-0ubuntu1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 64.0.3282.119-0ubuntu1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 64.0.3282.119-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '64.0.3282.119-0ubuntu1').
